questions.question: How do I add my previous injections history?
questions.answer:
To add your previous injection history:

1. Temporarily disable the inventory tracking feature
2. Use the 'Log Now' button on the dashboard to manually add past injections
3. Re-enable inventory tracking once you've completed logging your history

questions.question: Does the app support peptide blending?
questions.answer: Currently, peptide blending is not available in the app. However, this feature is actively under development and will be included in the near future, with a planned release in June 2025. Our team is working to implement this functionality in a way that ensures accuracy and ease of use.

questions.question: Is there a lifetime access or one-time purchase option?
questions.answer:
Currently, we do not offer a lifetime access or one-time purchase option. We're focused on providing consistent updates and improvements through our subscription model to ensure the highest quality service and features.

We are evaluating the possibility of introducing a lifetime access option in the future, but it's not a priority in our current development roadmap.

questions.question: How can I cancel my subscription?
questions.answer:
To cancel your subscription, follow these steps:

1. Open the Settings app: Locate and open the Settings app on your iPhone or iPad.
2. Tap your name: At the top of the Settings app, tap your Apple ID or name.
3. Select Subscriptions: Scroll down and tap on "Subscriptions".
4. Find the subscription: Locate Peptide Log in your list of active subscriptions.
5. Tap the subscription: Tap on Peptide Log subscription.
6. Cancel Subscription: Tap "Cancel Subscription" at the bottom of the screen.
7. Confirm cancellation: Tap "Confirm" to finalize the cancellation.

You will continue to have access to premium features until the end of your current billing period.

questions.question: This app isn't showing up under my subscriptions and therefore I can't cancel my free trial. How do I resolve this?
questions.answer:
The free trial is not connected to any credit card or subscription account. The app simply grants full access for seven days to all tools. After the trial period, only the plotter and calculator remain available until you purchase an active subscription.

Since the free trial doesn't involve any payment or subscription setup, you don't need to cancel anything. If you choose not to continue using the app after the trial ends, no action is required on your part.

questions.question: Is my health data stored anywhere besides my device?
questions.answer:
No. Your privacy is our highest priority, especially when handling sensitive medical data. All of your peptide and health information remains exclusively on your device and is never transmitted to our servers or any third parties.

In the near future, we will introduce optional iCloud sync capability, allowing you to securely back up your data and synchronize across your devices. Even with this feature, only you will have access to your encrypted data through your personal Apple ID.

For more information about Apple's data security practices for health information, please visit: https://support.apple.com/en-us/102651

questions.question: Why is my plan not working correctly?
questions.answer:
Sometimes during app updates, active plans may experience issues. While we try to avoid this as much as possible, it can occasionally happen. If your plan is not functioning correctly, you'll need to:

1. Go to the Plans section in the app
2. Find the problematic plan and mark it as inactive
3. Create a new plan with your desired settings

This will resolve most plan-related issues. If problems persist after creating a new plan, please contact support.

questions.question: Why is my weight data missing or not displaying?
questions.answer:
If your weight chart appears empty, you may need to grant Peptide Log access to your Apple Health data. Follow these steps to enable access:

1. Open the Health app: Locate and open the Health app on your iPhone.
2. Access your profile: Tap your profile picture (upper right corner on iPhone) or "Profile" (upper left corner on iPad).
3. Navigate to Apps: Under the Privacy section, tap "Apps".
4. Select the app: Find and select "Peptide Log" from the list of apps.
5. Enable desired categories: Turn on access for weight data and any other health data categories you want the app to use.
6. Check for other app permissions: Some features may also require additional permissions, which can be managed in the Settings app under Privacy & Security.

questions.question: Why is my weight data incorrect or showing extreme values?
questions.answer:
If your weight data shows implausible values (either too high or too low), the issue likely stems from incorrect entries in Apple Health. To resolve this:

1. Open the Apple Health app
2. Navigate to the Browse tab and select Weight
3. Review your weight history for any obvious errors
4. Remove or correct any inaccurate entries

Once corrected in Apple Health, the accurate data should synchronize with Peptide Log.

questions.question: What if my question isn't answered here?
questions.answer:
If you have a question that isn't addressed in our FAQ, please send us a feature request or support inquiry through the app. Our team is committed to responding to all inquiries within two business days.

Your feedback helps us improve the app and expand our knowledge base with information that matters to our users.
